title: 111_s1647
content: The "Assistance for Unemployed Workers Extension Act" extends the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program is extended by amending certain dates in the Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008. The Struggling Families Act is amended to include the Assistance for Unemployed Workers Extension Act. The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008. The Assistance for Unemployed Workers and Struggling Families Act is amended to extend the increase in unemployment compensation benefits. The effective date of the amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Act. The Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008 is amended to include a new subsection for a third tier of benefits for individuals in extended benefit periods. The Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008 is amended to include a new subsection for a third tier of benefits for individuals in extended benefit periods, limiting the amount to 50 percent of total regular compensation or 13 times the average weekly benefit amount. The Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008 is amended to include a new subsection for a third tier of benefits for individuals in extended benefit periods, limiting the amount to 50 percent of total regular compensation or 13 times the average weekly benefit amount. The amendment specifies adjustments to be made in certain scenarios, such as substituting numbers and excluding specific requirements. The Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008 is amended to include a new subsection for a third tier of benefits for individuals in extended benefit periods, limiting the amount to 50 percent of total regular compensation or 13 times the average weekly benefit amount. Coordination rules are outlined for the payment of emergency unemployment compensation and extended compensation, with limitations on the augmentation of an individual's account under this subsection. Conforming amendments are made to section 4007(b)(2) of the Act. The amendments made by this section to the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008, include changes to subsections (c) and (d) of section 4002. The effective date for these amendments is tied to the enactment of the Act, with additional emergency unemployment compensation only payable for weeks of unemployment after the Act's enactment date. SEC. 5. Extension of full federal funding of extended unemployment compensation for a limited period. The Assistance for Unemployed Workers and Struggling Families Act is amended to change dates from January 1, 2010, to January 1, 2011, and from June 1, 2010, to June 1, 2011. Additionally, the extension of temporary federal matching for the first week of extended benefits is amended to change the date from May 30, 2010, to May 30, 2011. These amendments will take effect as if included in the original enactment. The amendment made by subsection (b) shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2008. SEC. 6. ADDITIONAL EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS UNDER THE RAILROAD UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE ACT. Amendment to the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act to extend benefits until June 30, 2010 and December 31, 2010. An additional $175,000,000 is appropriated for extended unemployment benefits. The Railroad Retirement Board is appropriated $807,000 for administrative expenses related to extended unemployment benefits. The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the Assistance for Unemployed Workers and Struggling Families Act.
